body_html:
@jgong5 Python API is really just a binding to the C++ interface. So we can focus on the C++ API first.

  1. We don't have plans to do int8 calibration yet but it's just because we are still polishing the backend API. We can discuss this a bit more and see how to support it.
  2. What do you mean multiple backends? We plan to have a generic subgraph optimization framework which supports multiple backend, if this is what you were asking about.
  3. Our focus right now is graph optimization for inference.
body_text:
@jgong5 Python API is really just a binding to the C++ interface. So we can focus on the C++ API first.

We don't have plans to do int8 calibration yet but it's just because we are still polishing the backend API. We can discuss this a bit more and see how to support it.
What do you mean multiple backends? We plan to have a generic subgraph optimization framework which supports multiple backend, if this is what you were asking about.
Our focus right now is graph optimization for inference.
body:
@jgong5 Python API is really just a binding to the C++ interface. So we can focus on the C++ API first. 
1. We don't have plans to do int8 calibration yet but it's just because we are still polishing the backend API. We can discuss this a bit more and see how to support it. 
2. What do you mean multiple backends? We plan to have a generic subgraph optimization framework which supports multiple backend, if this is what you were asking about. 
3. Our focus right now is graph optimization for inference.
